abstract: Steven P. Jobs, who has cancer, made Apple one of the world’s most valuable companies. Timothy D. Cook will take over as chief executive.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs, who has cancer, made Apple one of the world’s most valuable companies. Timothy D. Cook will take over as chief executive.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Steven P. Jobs, whose insistent vision that he knew what consumers wanted made Apple one of the world’s most valuable and influential companies, is stepping down as chief executive, the company announced late Wednesday.

headline.main: Jobs Steps Down at Apple, Saying He Can’t Meet Duties
headline.print_headline: Jobs Steps Down. Saying He Cannot Meet His Duties
